Memories, this game was no doubt amazing.

There's not much that I can say that hasn't already been said about this game.  It's great through and through, provides interesting combat and story that gets expanded upon as the game continues.  Puzzles are intruiging even the second and third times through the game, and it just gets better after that.  The first time I ever explored Highway 17 and the surrounding areas might be my favorite moment in gaming.  I also want to plug the fun and interesting speedrunning scene, and all the fun you can have with the Source Engine.  But yeah, this game is fucking great.

A very good game just because of the pistol. I hate how the NPCs get in your way, cringey conversations with Alyx and how absolutely incompetent the combine are, rushing at you like a bunch of idiots and cant aim past 2 feet (in comparison with the HECU from HL1 which I almost mistook as real players because they're that good at doing their jobs making escaping Black Mesa a near impossibility for both Gordon and the Player) but I'll give this game a pass because of THE pistol.

The HL2 pistol is by far the best and most satisfying weapon that has ever existed in a video game. Its pops heads like nobody's business. Its so accurate, sounds and recoils just right. Nothing else compares to the HL2 pistol. Spoiler alert; you get it when you bash the head of the first combine police with your crowbar. What a nice way to get the best if not the most legendary weapon in a video game.
